Gantikan Armada Tua, Pemkot Cimahi Beli Tiga Truk Sampah Baru
07 Nov 2019, 14:17 by Ririn Nur Febriani
CIMAHI, (PR).- Pemerintah Kota Cimahi menambah jumlah truk pengangkut sampah di Kota Cimahi. Hal itu dilakukan guna meningkatkan layanan operasional pengangkutan sampah.
Pada tahun 2019, Pemkot Cimahi membeli tiga unit truk sampah terdiri dari dua unit Arm Rol dan satu unit Dump Truck. Untuk pengadaan dua unit Arm Roll, pagu angggaran yang disediakan mencapai Rp1.010.000.000 yang bersumber dari Bantuan Provinsi (Banprov) Jawa Barat. Sedangkan pengadaan dump truk bersumber dari Dana Alokasi Khusus (DAK) yang mencapai Rp 420.000.000.
Kepala Dinas Lingkungan Hidup (DLH) Kota Cimahi, M Ronny mengatakan bahwa pengadaan tiga unit truk pengangkut sampah tersebut menambah kendaraan operasional layanan sampah. Terutama untuk mengangkut sampah dari Kota Cimahi ke TPAS Sarimukti. "Dengan tambahan kendaraan, berarti sekarang total kami punya 39 armada. Fungsinya sebagai sarana angkutan sampah dari TPS ke TPA," jelasnya, Kamis 7 November 2019.
Ronny mengatakan, belanja truk pengangkut sampah dilakukan untuk menggantikan armada lama yang sering mengalami kerusakan. "Ada beberapa armada yang sudah uzur. Mobil tahun 2002 masih ada, sering mogok," terang Ronny.
Kondisi kendaraan yang menurun berpengaruh pada beban operasional. "Kendaraan yang sudah lama memang boros. Masalahnya ada bocor klep harus ke bengkel. Kontruksi sudah tua, harus diperbaiki," tambahnya.
Untuk sementara ini, lanjut Ronny, jumlah armada yang dimiliki untuk mengangkut sampah ke TPAS Sarimukti masih ideal. Rata-rata sampah yang diangkut per harinya mencapai 225 ton. 
"Tidak semua sampah optimal terangkut. Sebab, produksi sampah di Kota Cimahi mencapai 268 ton per hari. Salah satu solusi untuk penanggulangan sisa sampah ialah pengelolaan sampah sejak di rumah tangga dengan menggalakkan program zero waste yang sudah berlangsung sejak tahun 2018," katanya.
Sejauh ini, program tersebut sudah menyentuh 41 Rukun Warga (RW) atau sekitar 13 persen dari total keseluruhan 312 RW. "Baru 41 RW dari 312 RW. Tahun ini target 40 RW yang diintervensi, masih dalam tahap edukasi dari pintu ke pintu karena sampah tanggung jawab bersama," tandasnya.***

Replace Old Fleet, Cimahi City Government Buy Three New Garbage Trucks
Nov 7 2019, 14:17 by Ririn Nur Febriani
CIMAHI, (PR) .- The Government of Cimahi City has increased the number of garbage trucks in Cimahi City. This was done in order to improve operational services for transporting waste.
In 2019, the City Government of Cimahi bought three garbage trucks consisting of two Arm Rol units and one Dump Truck. For the procurement of two Arm Roll units, the budget ceiling amounting to Rp1,010,000,000 comes from the Provincial Assistance (Banprov) of West Java. While the procurement of dump trucks is sourced from the Special Allocation Fund (DAK), which reaches Rp 420,000,000.
Head of the Cimahi City Environment Agency (DLH), M Ronny, said that the procurement of the three garbage trucks added operational vehicles for waste services. Especially to transport waste from the City of Cimahi to TPAS Sarimukti. "With the addition of vehicles, it means that now we have a total of 39 fleets. The function is as a means of transporting garbage from TPS to TPA," he explained, Thursday, November 7, 2019.
Ronny said that shopping for garbage trucks was carried out to replace the old fleet that was often damaged. "There are several fleets that are old. Cars in 2002 still exist, often breaking down," said Ronny.
The declining condition of the vehicle has an effect on operating expenses. "Vehicles that have long been wasteful. The problem is that there is a valve leaking to the garage. The construction is old, must be repaired," he added.
For the time being, continued Ronny, the number of the fleet owned to transport waste to the Sarimukti TPAS is still ideal. Average garbage transported per day reaches 225 tons.
"Not all garbage is optimally transported. Because, the production of waste in Cimahi City reaches 268 tons per day. One solution to deal with the rest of the waste is to manage waste from the household by promoting the zero waste program that has been going on since 2018," he said.
So far, the program has touched 41 RT (RW) or around 13 percent of the total of 312 RWs. "Only 41 RWs from 312 RWs. This year the target of 40 RWs that are intervened, is still in the door-to-door education stage because of the shared responsibility of waste," he said. ***
